data.instructions: A user has been assigned a privileged role, which may indicate unauthorized privilege escalation or administrative misuse.

rule_metadata.description: A user has been assigned a privileged role, which may indicate unauthorized privilege escalation or administrative misuse.

data.instructions: Gather details of all users - (By adding sheet to this excel)
Username, Role Assigned, Time of Assignment, Initiator, Source IP, Location

rule_metadata.description: Username, Role Assigned, Time of Assignment, Initiator, Source IP, Location

data.instructions: Determine if the assigned role is high-risk (e.g., Global Admin)

rule_metadata.description: Determine if the assigned role is high-risk (e.g., Global Admin)

data.instructions: Look for unusual sign-in patterns by the assigned user for last 7 days

rule_metadata.description: Look for unusual sign-in patterns by the assigned user for last 7 days

data.input details: Observed the Events and checked user(Adminchintala) was accessed into MS-PIM, nothing Suspicious activities found, closing as FP.
data.instructions: Validate if the assigning user had legitimate access and permissions
data.reviewer comments: Check the Historical data of initiator  & alerts on initiator

data.instructions: if suspicious, escalate to L3/IT for investigation
data.reviewer comments: If  initiator  found compromise then Escalte to L3

data.inputs required: if True Positive - Inform to IT Team to Reset the account, Revoke the MFA tokens, Temporary disable the account
data.instructions: Reach out to the Network/EDR teams to block the detected suspicious IP, Inform user to reset password, maintain complex password and enable MFA.
data.reviewer comments: Also Reset the all actvie user sessions  & Need to perform user precompromise & post compromise  actvity

data.instructions: After all the investigation document the steps taken, findings, and any remediation actions required

data.input details:
These indicate malicious or unauthorized role assignments:
Attacker assigns themselves or another compromised account to a privileged role (e.g., Global Admin).
Privileged role assigned outside business hours from an unusual IP or geolocation.
Role assignment follows a successful risky sign-in (e.g., impossible travel or TOR exit node).
Assignment made by an unknown or suspicious app/service principal.
Multiple privileged roles assigned in quick succession—suggesting lateral movement.
Assignment to a dormant or deactivated account suddenly re-enabled.

These are unusual but legitimate actions:
Privileged role assigned temporarily via PIM (Privileged Identity Management) for a valid task.
Security team grants temporary access for an urgent incident response.
Admin assigns a role to a new hire during onboarding, but outside normal hours.
Role assignment from a new IP due to remote work or travel.

These are normal operations that trigger alerts unnecessarily:
Admin assigns a role to a user as part of routine access management.
Assignment from a known corporate IP or trusted device, but not yet whitelisted.
Bulk role assignments during a migration or reorganization.
Temporary elevation via PIM that’s not filtered out in the rule logic.

data.inputs required: Rule#280-Detect when One or more Sophos services are missing or not running.
data.instructions: Description:The rule will detect when one or more sophos services are missing or not running properly
Check the device, name of service (missing or not running) , source IP, source name, time

data.inputs required: Check Sophos Console for the user health agent status
data.input details: Triaging Steps performed: Check ip reputation - clean. Check hostname .. ARQ-00374 Check history – for 90 day s/ 30 days.. etc – NA Check signin logs -- NA Escalating (Yes/ No) Yes Closure comments for TP / FP / Benign Positive: TP (As checked All sophos services are not running) INC0095259
data.instructions: Check in the sophos console >> My products >>  Endpoint >> computer (check with a bad status) update the user details if any service is missing.

data.inputs required: Check if the status all the services are running or not
data.input details: Yes, verified all the details no suspicious found. All services are running with the user.
data.instructions:
If all services are running ok, no need to take action. 
If any service is missing raise a ticket or Incident to SSIT Team.

data.inputs required: Make a word document to list the details of user if any of the sophos services missing
data.instructions: Attached the details as an Artificats to next sheet based on the details available in the events, update accordingly in the word document.

data.inputs required: Raise a Incident ticket in SNOW
data.instructions: Steps to create incident (Ref: Incident Screeshot)

rule_metadata.description: Steps to create incident (Ref: Incident Screeshot)

data.inputs required: Upload the same word document (Step no. 6) and also upload the "Sophos perm Fix" video which is shared in the soc group
data.instructions: Attach word document with all the details and upload the video, For video link refer next sheet (Video Link tab)

data.inputs required: Follow up with the IT Team for raising the ticket
data.input details: Not required.Because all services are running.
data.instructions: Regularly Check for the updates from the SSIT team for status of the ticket.
